summary: Create a Valentine proposal-style website (similar to the provided URL) with customizable branding and shareable message/proposal interactions backed by an ICP Motoko canister.

existing_features.title: Website scaffold with configurable site name/branding
existing_features.description: Implemented a React/Vite frontend with page layout components (Header, Hero, Footer, LandingPage) and an AdminPanel to manage branding. Branding is centralized in frontend config (e.g., config/branding and useSiteBranding hook) so the site name/branding can be changed/replaced without reworking the page structure.

existing_features.title: Valentine proposal interactive landing experience
existing_features.description: Implemented dedicated Valentine proposal UI components (e.g., ValentineProposal, Hero, MessageSection) composing an interactive landing/proposal experience within the React/Vite/Tailwind frontend.

existing_features.title: Shareable message/proposal content via backend storage
existing_features.description: Added sharing and message functionality (e.g., ShareSection, StorageClient, backend canister updates) to persist and retrieve proposal/message data via the Motoko backend and frontend backend actor bindings.

existing_features.title: ICP actor + Internet Identity authentication hooks integrated
existing_features.description: Frontend includes and wires ICP actor/authentication hooks (useActor, useInternetIdentity, query hooks) to support authenticated interactions with the backend canister.

existing_features.title: Change the recipient flow so the page initially shows a single prominent link-style call-to-action reading exactly "Click here for a surprise" instead of immediately showing the "Will you be my Valentine, Keya?" question.

When the recipient clicks/taps "Click here for a surprise", transition the UI to display the existing Valentine proposal question "Will you be my Valentine, Keya?" along with the existing Yes/No interactions and animations.
Ensure the Share section remains available in the proposal experience (after the teaser is clicked) and continues to copy the current URL and a prefilled English message.

new_feature_requests.summary: Change the share/landing link text to 'Click here for a surprise' and only show the 'Will you be my Valentine?' question after the link is clicked (transition to the question view/page).

architectural_notes: Frontend implemented with React + Vite + Tailwind and shadcn/ui component set.
Branding configuration is centralized (frontend/src/config/branding.ts) and accessed via a dedicated hook (useSiteBranding) for consistent site-name/branding replacement across the UI.
Backend canister uses Motoko; frontend includes actor/auth hooks (useActor, useInternetIdentity) suggesting Internet Identity integration is wired into the app scaffold.
Frontend now includes a Valentine proposal-specific component set (ValentineProposal, MessageSection, ShareSection) layered on top of the base layout.
Frontend integrates a storage client and backend actor bindings to persist/share proposal messages through the Motoko canister.
Build template and project scaffolding were significantly expanded/standardized (build-template assets, scripts, configs) to support reproducible builds/deployments.
projectName: Add teaser link screen before showing the Valentine question
